author: xiaming
msg: r1439250 cannot fix the stackoverflow issue when running with java 7, so another idea from Jarek to try

author: ruchithf
msg: The user exception here is simply used as a flag to indicate success or failure of authentication.
There's no need to associate any information that the user includes in the user's exception, in the exception generated by Rampart.

author: ruchithf
msg: Fixed the issue raised in this [1] discussion.
RampartUsernameTokenValidator overrides the verifyPlaintextPassword method of org.apache.ws.security.validate.UsernameTokenValidator
The default implementation expects the callback handler to supply the plain text password (when a username token with a plain text password is used), which should not be possible in practice.

author: larsh
